C1: Coronavirus is a group of viruses that can cause diseases such as the common cold, severe acute respiratory syndrome, and Middle East respiratory syndrome.  Symptoms of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) may appear 2 to 14 days after exposure  You can still spread COVID-19 before you develop symptoms. This is called pre-symptomatic transmission. Common symptoms can include:
C2: Shortness of breath or difficulty breathing .
C17: Early symptoms of Covid-19 may include loss
C18: of sense of taste or smell .
L1: Lung opacities are abnormal signs not exceeding 3 cm in size that appear on a chest x-ray or CT scan. They are the result of inflammation and may be accompanied by an unexplained cough or a bloody cough if the cause is benign or malignant tumors that appear in the form of an abscess and appear as opacity only on the x-ray.  It may be accompanied by a high temperature and is often due to diseases, some of which are benign, such as pneumonia, tuberculosis, fungal infection, bronchial fever, and some lung clots, but many of them are due to malignant tumors, especially if their size exceeds 2 cm :
L2: Common symptoms of lung opacity are as follows.
L3: Cough with yellow, green, or bloody mucus .
L4: Blue or white fingertips or lips .
T1: Tuberculosis is an infectious disease of the lungs, most often caused by a type of bacteria, and is transmitted through the air when infected people cough, sneeze, or spit. The common symptoms of tuberculosis are as follows :
T9: Chest pain or pain while breathing and coughing .
O1: Pneumonia is an infection that causes inflammation of the alveoli in one or both lungs. The alveoli may fill with fluid or pus Signs and symptoms of pneumonia range from mild to severe, depending on factors such as the type of bacteria causing the infection, age, and general health status . May include signs and symptoms of pneumonia :
O3: Chest pain when breathing or coughing .
O6: A lower than normal body temperature in adults older than 65 years and people with weak immune systems . . May include signs and symptoms of pneumonia :
Y1: Signs and symptoms of pneumonia vary depending on the child is age and the cause of the pneumonia and symptoms are often one or more of the following :
Y2: Breathing with snoring or whistling sounds .
